sub_title: 🙂👉Follow Me To Learn About New Jobs @Booking.com |  ❎Twitter @dakotta
summary:
As a dynamic professional with a proven record in project management and data-driven decision-making, I bring a unique blend of strategic thinking and hands-on experience to the table. My proficiency spans across project design and execution, risk management, communication campaigns, and vendor relationship management.

In the marketing sector, I have honed skills in branding, employer branding, demand generation, social media marketing, and enhancing employee engagement. This has involved overseeing remote teams, coordinating with a network recruitment professionals across 12 countries, and managing corporate-wide talent and employer brand strategies with budgets up to $21M.

In line with my project management abilities, I am also deeply dedicated to fostering diversity and inclusion in the workplace. This commitment is reflected through my participation in various employee resource groups at Booking.com and my decade-long leadership in a diversity organization at BreakTheGlassCeiling.com.

My track record includes forming strategic alliances with businesses and non-profit organizations in many countries, crafting corporate brand recognition strategies using market analyses, and executing talent acquisition plans for scaling workforces across various sectors. I am well-versed in Agile and Scrum methodologies and hold a Lean Six Sigma Blackbelt certification. I am always ready for new challenges and opportunities for growth and learning.

Please feel free to connect with me.

education.degree_name: Associate of Arts and Sciences - AAS

certifications.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt Certification (Program & Project Management)
Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification (Program & Project Management)
Lean Six Sigma White Belt Certification (Program & Project Management)

projects.title: Educational Research for Masters
projects.description:
Rome, Italy (January 2013 - July 2013)
 Invited by the Vatican's Pontifical School (The Pontifical Gregorian University) to continue my final coursework and research.  Germany (Berlin) 10/2012 Germany Close Up - Fellowship geared towards North American Jews with a first-hand experience of modern Germany.   

Eastern Europe, Balkans & Turkey (September 2011 – January 2011)
 Created a documentary and traveled extensively in Romania and researched Poland, Czech Republic, Austria, Slovakia, Hungary, Slovenia, Croatia, Serbia, Bosnia, Montenegro, Kosovo, Macedonia, Albania, Bulgaria, and Turkey.

  Australia (November 2009 – December 2009) 
Traveled extensively in Australia researching culture and how religion affects business practices, policies, and ethics between Aborigines and Natives. Additionally, attended the Parliament of World Religions.  

Israel (July 2009 – August 2009) 
Traveled extensively in Israel and Palestine understanding how religion affects business practices, policies, and ethics in addition to researching the Mid-East conflict.  

Southeast Asia (January 2009 – May 2009 ) 
Traveled extensively in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia researching culture and how religion affects business practices, policies, and ethics.

------------------
4.5 years full-time of graduate courses and research led to the making of my amalgamated degree from the Claremont Colleges, UC Berkeley, The Graduate Theological Union and the Vatican doing a Masters of Divinity focusing on Applied Ethics, Islamic Education, and Jewish Education. I was able to do field research in Rome, Israel, SE Asia, Australia, Eastern Europe, Israel, and Turkey understanding how religion affected culture and business practices. A major component to this was ethics - the way people's religion affected their business practices.

profile_positions.description:
As the Recruitment Marketing Program Manager, I've successfully led the creation and implementation of an end-to-end employee referral recruitment strategy that prioritizes candidate experience and leverages relationships with sourcing teams and employee resource groups (ERGs).

Highlights of my accomplishments in this role include:

- Refreshing the policy and employee value proposition (EVP) of the employee referral program, resulting in referrals becoming a top channel for hires.
- Improving the candidate and employee experience by working closely with cross-functional teams to understand all facets of the process and make data-driven improvements.
- Developing a scalable employee engagement strategy that aligns with the company's vision, values, and business strategy.
- Implementing a trackable performance framework that provides data-backed insights to optimize campaigns and drive continuous improvement.
profile_positions.title: Talent Marketing Program Manager

profile_positions.description: As an elected Works Council member in the Netherlands, I represented the interests of employees by advocating for their rights, working conditions, and overall well-being. This involved collaborating with management to ensure compliance with labor laws and company policies, as well as participating in negotiations on behalf of employees.
profile_positions.title: Works Council Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
As an Ethics Mentor, I served as a liaison between the compliance and ethics department and my global team, promoting awareness of ethical practices and ensuring compliance with relevant policies and regulations. Key responsibilities included:

- Mentoring a team of 5 in our Global People Department
- Collaborating with the compliance and ethics department to ensure effective communication and implementation of policies and procedures
- Facilitating training sessions on ethical practices and promoting a culture of ethics within the department
- Providing guidance and support to colleagues on ethics-related matters, including identifying and addressing potential ethical concerns
- Contributing to the development and implementation of effective compliance and ethics programs at both the department and company level.
profile_positions.title: Ethics Mentor

profile_positions.description: As an Emergency Response Officer, I am trained to be the first line of response in any workplace emergency situation, including fires, accidents, and other building emergencies. I am equipped with the necessary skills to save lives by providing first aid, incident communication, limiting and controlling early fires, and performing evacuations. Additionally, I am proficient in operating and using AEDs (Automated External Defibrillators).
profile_positions.title: Emergency Response Officer

profile_positions.description:
As a Global Program Manager Operations within the Talent Acquisition team, I led the design, implementation, and launch of crucial programs and projects to achieve our objectives. My responsibilities included developing and implementing business plans, processes, and strategies to strengthen relationships, drive adoption, ensure standardization, consistency, and compliance across programs, and managing risks.

I have extensive experience in change management, communication flows, process flows, and risk management. I was instrumental in implementing two global CRM platforms, Phenom People and Eightfold. I also created and launched an Alumni program, fostering community engagement, content sharing, and job distribution.

In addition, I spearheaded the execution of multichannel communication plans to ensure ongoing internal communications priorities were met. This included writing, producing, and editing various communication materials such as intranet stories, emails, and other collateral.

To capitalize on untapped potential, I reviewed analytics reports and provided recommendations for improvement. I also worked closely with the global onboarding team to develop and implement a virtual onboarding program from the ground up.

My tools of choice for project management include Trello, Lucidchart, and Signavio.
profile_positions.title: Global Program Manager - Operations

profile_positions.description:
As an Interim Business Partner Program Manager on the Partner Marketing team, I collaborated with business partners to provide expert marketing consultation and effective solutions.

My responsibilities included:

- Advocating for partner needs, proactively identifying solutions, and educating commercial operations to improve the quality of business marketing units.
- Developing and executing strategic, tactical, and operational marketing partnership plans to meet objectives and ensure timely completion.
- Ensuring that commercial marketing operations exceeded our agreed-upon outcomes and targets for the marketing business unit, collaborating with area leaders and adjusting priorities as necessary.
- Monitoring and tracking progress on marketing priorities and escalating issues as needed to ensure timely delivery.
- Communicating marketing strategies, priorities, and vision to commercial operations team members, working with marketing and commercial operations leaders to translate them into business priorities and execution.
- Utilized TargetProcess as a tool for project management.
profile_positions.title: Interim Partner Marketing Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a Global Project Manager for Operations, I was responsible for managing the people technology stack and tools such as LinkedIn, Indeed, Glassdoor, HackerRank, Monster, GitHub, StackOverflow, and country-specific vendors for job postings. Additionally, I managed global recruitment agencies and vendors.

Accomplishments:
As a Global Project Manager for Operations, I was responsible for managing the people technology stack and tools such as LinkedIn, Indeed, Glassdoor, HackerRank, Monster, GitHub, StackOverflow, and country-specific vendors for job postings. Additionally, I managed global recruitment agencies and vendors.

Accomplishments:
- Developed a recruitment agency tracker, resulting in a significant decrease in global agency usage and cost.
- Conducted semi-annual RFPs and vendor reviews to ensure proper budget allocation.
- Successfully reduced recruitment agency spend by over 50% and increased tool usage by 90% through the creation of audit reports.

Responsibilities:
- Assisted in training global recruiters to maximize tool and resource usage.
- Worked with global recruitment agencies to minimize time-to-fill.
- Led the global rollout of Textio to assist with diversity recruitment.
- Partnered with the People Analytics team to analyze and produce advanced Greenhouse metrics leadership reports.Developed a recruitment agency tracker, resulting in a significant decrease in global agency usage and cost.

- Successfully reduced recruitment agency spend by over 50% and increased tool usage by 90% through the creation of audit reports.

profile_positions.title: Global Project Manager - Operations

profile_positions.description:
I was hired to disrupt the hiring process for global tech and non-tech offices, with the goal of hiring more than 1,000 Tech & Product individuals across multiple locations.

My accomplishments include:
- Leading a team that curated Textio-framed jobs for A/B testing and assessments.
- Developing comprehensive recruitment reporting and insights, identifying trends and operational opportunities.
- Working with the people analytics team to create robust and scalable dashboards in Google Data Studio, Looker, and Tableau that focused on key metrics such as cost per source, time to fill, recruiter metrics, candidate pipelines, forecasting, and quality of source by location, position title, department, and time in Greenhouse.
- Streamlining cross-referenced site reports to make data-driven decisions when posting jobs by comparing total visits, traffic shares, visit duration, bounce rates, geography, channel overview, referring categories, organic/paid search, social traffic, ad networks, and more.

My responsibilities included:
- Partnering with talent acquisition teams to build and execute an events strategy for in-person and virtual events aligned with our hiring and diversity goals.
- Executing campaign strategies across social media platforms, job boards, email, and other digital marketing channels, pivoting based on their effectiveness.
- Using Textio to A/B test job titles, content per posted location, and keywords to optimize the quality of CVs the recruiters reviewed.

I was also featured in the Hired.com podcast and HackerRank podcast, sharing my insights on how analytics and funnel metrics drive serious conversion in recruitment.

Hired.com Podcast:
How Analytics & Funnel Metrics Drive Serious Conversion at Booking.com
https://hired.com/blog/employers/analytics-funnel-metrics-drive-conversion-booking/

HackerRank Podcast:
Hiring Software Developers Globally: Tips for Evaluating Candidates From Around The World
https://goo.gl/yTRLah
profile_positions.title: Global Recruitment Manager Strategy, Analytics & Assessments

profile_positions.description:
As a chaplain in training, I assist individuals in processing life events and deepening their spirituality. I help them find inner motivation, trust, hope, inspiration, strength, and zeal, and work with them to foster spiritual growth, reflection, and well-being.

My approach involves two main processes to help patients affirm their identity and worldview. The first is personalizing their worldview by helping them make it their own and integrating new perspectives into their thinking. The second is developing a worldview that helps them engage with life, clarify their values, and move forward with purpose.

I am currently raising funds for the San Francisco Night Ministry, a multi-faith organization that provides spiritual care and community support on the streets, on the phone, and at night. Their mission is to offer care to everyone, regardless of faith or no faith, without judgment, conversion, or agendas. The ministry offers community chaplaincy services and crisis intervention, serving the human and spiritual needs of people in San Francisco during the darkest hours.

Please consider donating to this registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization to help make a difference and support those in need. Thank you for your contribution.

Learn more about the San Francisco Night Ministry by navigating here: https://sfnightministry.org/programs/
profile_positions.title: Chaplain Resident

profile_positions.description:
I led the strategic sourcing marketing strategy as part of Amazon's High Volume Hiring Hourly Sourcing Program. My role included overseeing a team of five sourcers and executing 21 site-specific recruitment marketing strategies totaling $21M in 21 diverse regions throughout North America. 

- I initiated relationships with diversity and inclusion partners to attract diverse candidates, including veterans, and worked with management to reclaim ownership of outsourced facilities. 
- As a subject matter expert in prospecting techniques and tools, I utilized information retrieval, data extraction, web scraping, continuous process improvement, process automation, and customer relationship management to optimize our recruitment efforts. 
- I tracked industry events, technology trends, and changes within the employment landscape, and participated in special projects in market mapping, market intelligence, talent community relationship building, and prospect attraction. 
- I leveraged various marketing channels, such as billboards, newspapers, radio sponsorships, Pandora, social media, email marketing, mailers, flyers, and canvassing to achieve our hiring goals.
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Marketing

profile_positions.description:
Client: Cmpute.io
I created an effective strategies in Social Media Marketing, Marketing Communications, Market Research, Online Marketing, New Business Development, Product Development, Online Advertising, Product Management, Demand Generation, Marketing Strategy, and Lead generation.

I led a team of four individuals and oversaw the development and curation of engaging content for our social media channels, including Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter. The content included various formats such as blog articles, infographics, e-books, podcasts, and videos, which helped us to build links and attract leads.

I managed our SEO and PPC campaigns on Google and Google Adwords, which resulted in increased visibility and traffic to our website. Additionally, I ensured that our digital advertising was placed on niche industry sites, promoting the right messaging to the targeted audience.

To increase brand visibility, I utilized live-tweeting to promote our presence at AWS conferences. I also collaborated with the marketing team to create strategic market plans, which included budget allocation, organization, and actions for each relevant channel.

Finally, I organized brainstorming sessions with the internal creative and marketing teams to find innovative ways to scale profitable traffic. My efforts significantly contributed to the growth of Cmpute.io, and the successful adoption of our cost-optimization strategies by our clients.
profile_positions.title: Digital Marketing Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Client: Dome9.com

As the social media consultant for Dome9 Security, a company providing network security and compliance services for AWS, I utilized various strategies and techniques to drive marketing and sales success, including:

- Leading a team of 5 individuals to orchestrate successful marketing programs, including field marketing, demand generation, and content creation, resulting in 1,500 marketing qualified leads (MQLs) in just 8 months.
- Creating and implementing developer and security-operations programs to boost visibility within the AWS ecosystem, including attendance at various AWS conferences in Berlin, Chicago, London, Sydney, and San Francisco.
- Developing a comprehensive go-to-market strategy and key collateral to drive qualified sales leads (SQLs).
- Generating leads through social media marketing, offering downloadable guides and e-books in exchange for email addresses, and directing traffic to landing pages to build email contact lists.
- Curating content for social media channels (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter) to promote link-building and attract potential leads, including blog articles, infographics, e-books, podcasts, and videos.
- Managing search engine optimization (SEO) for search campaigns and pay-per-click (PPC) ads on Google and Google AdWords.
- Placing digital ads on niche industry sites to ensure effective communication of marketing messages.
- Conducting market research to inform product development and marketing strategy.

Overall, I leveraged my expertise in sales management, new business development, product management, online advertising, demand generation, and lead generation to drive success for Dome9 Security.
profile_positions.title: Social Media Manager Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Client: TheNewStack.io

We were tasked with promoting and marketing the breakfast event at the Open Stack Summit in Austin, Texas in 2016, which was a highly anticipated event in the tech industry.

As part of our marketing efforts, we assisted in curating content for various social media platforms such as Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter, with the goal of creating engaging posts that would attract attendees to the event. We also utilized link-building and link magnets to drive traffic to the event's landing page.

To increase the number of potential leads for the event, we utilized effective lead generation techniques. This included boosting followers on social media platforms, offering a downloadable guide or e-book that required an email address, and directing traffic to landing pages where attendees could sign up and provide their contact information.

By utilizing these marketing strategies, we were able to successfully increase attendance and create buzz around the breakfast event at the Open Stack Summit in Austin, Texas in 2016.
profile_positions.title: Social Media Manager Consultant

 Assisted with content curation for social media channels (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter) for link-building and link magnets.

Keywords of what I did: Social Media Marketing, Marketing Communications, Sales Management, Market Research, Online Marketing, New Business Development, Product Development, Online Advertising, Product Management, Demand Generation, Marketing Strategy and Lead generation.
profile_positions.title: Demand Generation Manager Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Client: Appen.com

Appen, a leading provider of high-quality training data for machine learning, is the chosen outsource vendor for tech giants like Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft for user voice collection.

As a member of the team, I contributed to the successful collection of 5,000 diverse voices for a major voice collection project within just 8 months. This involved utilizing various strategies, including social media, community partnerships, and print materials to locate diverse candidates who could contribute to the project.

To accomplish this, I collaborated with the marketing team to develop effective social media campaigns that reached a wider audience and resulted in more qualified leads. We also developed relationships with community partners who could help us tap into diverse talent pools.

Through these efforts, we were able to identify and collect voices from individuals from different backgrounds, ages, and genders, providing a diverse and representative dataset for our clients.

Overall, my work in this project involved utilizing my skills in social media marketing, community partnerships, and lead generation to achieve our goals efficiently and effectively.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Specialist Consultant

profile_positions.description:
During my time at Grindr, I played an instrumental role in creating the organization's Employer Value Proposition (EVP) and employer brand. I successfully developed and implemented global and local campaigns, digital marketing strategies, social media marketing, and event production, which significantly contributed to Grindr's ability to attract highly skilled tech talent.

Here are some of my key accomplishments:
- Established programs to promote the Grindr backend stack in the developer community, resulting in thousands of inbound talent leads.
- Developed and executed the employer brand strategy, which established Grindr Labs as a unique entity and helped achieve market presence in top tech blogs such as VentureBeat and TheNewStack.
- Represented the company publicly at panels and speaking engagements.
- Organized Grindr's Tech Talks and technology brand materials to appeal to a broader audience and scheduled C-Level staff to discuss Grindr technology in depth.
- Worked with agencies and other news outlets to ensure optimal professional brand placement.
- Identified the director for Grindr4Equality and worked closely on this diversity and inclusion initiative.

Break The Glass Ceiling is the diversity job board and diversity resource center which helps to educate, enable, and help you succeed in today’s job market.  We offer the latest diversity articles, diversity statistics, a directory of diversity professional organizations, and jobs from employers looking to hire diverse talent. Our main goal is to help women, veterans and minorities get the right information that will help them get assisted in the best way possible.
>>>
Since founding the organization I assisted with
- Setting up the 501c3
- Recruiting the diversity board members
- Worked with statisticians on developing diversity data
- Worked with researchers on creating diversity partnerships and diversity lists
- Organizing diversity conferences
